definition: name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people
to do/to grow/to write or compose/to pretend/to regard as/to feel/writings or works

sentences.english: The Snow World wrote by Kawabata Yasunari is a famous masterpiece with unvarying artistic fascination.
sentences.chinese: 川端康成的《雪國》是一部具有恆久藝術魅力的名作。

sentences.english: He became acquainted with many well-known writers during her short stay there.
sentences.chinese: 她在那短暫逗留期間結識了許多名作家。

sentences.english: For this, Chinese famous writer Qian Zhongshu had an excellent moment.
sentences.chinese: 對此，中國著名作家錢鍾書先生有一個絕妙的評語。

sentences.english: Murakami haruki is currently a very famous author in Japan.
sentences.chinese: 村上春樹是日本當代著名作家。

sentences.english: I attempt to probe into this diary body of Yuan ZhongDao's masterpiece from thought content and artistic characteristics.
sentences.chinese: 從思想內容與藝術特色來探討中道的這部日記體名作。

sentences.english: Davies is busy adapting Brinkworth's latest novel for television.
sentences.chinese: 戴維斯忙於爲電視劇改編那個著名作家的最新小說。

sentences.english: Yan Zhen, a famous writer, is now a professor of Zhong Nan University.
sentences.chinese: 閻真，著名作家，現爲中南大學教授。

sentences.english: Voss is the masterpiece of the famous Australian writer, Patrick White.
sentences.chinese: 《探險家沃斯》是澳大利亞著名作家懷特的代表作。

sentences.english: The resulting masterpiece was the Admonitions Scroll.
sentences.chinese: 於是，就有了千古名作《女史箴圖》。

sentences.english: The Border Town was a representative work of Shen Congwen, a Modernistic famous writer of China, .
sentences.chinese: 《邊城》是中國現代著名作家沈從文的代表之作。

sentences.english: It is also the date of birth or death of other prominent authors such as Maurice Druon, K.Laxness, Vladimir Nabokov, Josep Pla and Manuel Mejía Vallejo.
sentences.chinese: 這一天，同樣也誕生或死亡了很多著名作家。

sentences.english: The book I randomly picked up was a kung fu novel by Louis Cha, a famous Hong Kong writer.
sentences.chinese: 我隨便撿了一本，是香港著名作家金庸寫的武俠小說。

sentences.english: "Sunflowers, " by Van Gogh, a painting from the same series as one of the stolen artworks, appears in this photo.
sentences.chinese: 上圖中梵高的名作《向日葵》系被盜畫作之一。

sentences.english: Though over 70, the famous writer had still been active;
sentences.chinese: 這位名作家儘管年逾70，仍然筆耕不輟。

sentences.english: The preface of this book is written by a famous writer.
sentences.chinese: 這本書的序言是由一個著名作家寫的。

sentences.english: Exception was made only for the Roman Carmen, well-known author of pre-war documentaries.
sentences.chinese: 而唯一可以破例的是戰前的著名作家，羅曼卡門。

definition: representative work (of an author or artist)
to create/to produce/to write/creative work/creation/CL:個|个[ge4]
the wording and purport of what one writes
authentic (painting or calligraphy)/genuine work (of famous artist)
